content.title: Thayi Bhagya Scheme(comprehensive Maternal Healthcare)
content.department: Department of Health and Family Welfare
content.beneficiary: Pregnant women belonging to BPL families
content.details: The scheme has been designed so that women belonging to BPL families can avail totally cashless treatment in these private hospitals. Under this scheme, the pregnant woman belonging to BPL family can avail delivery services free of cost in the registered private hospital near her house. She is not required to pay any charges right from the point of admission to discharge. The benefit is limited to the first two live deliveries.
benefits: Cashless treatment in registered private hospitals
eligibility: The benefit is limited to the first two deliveries
The candidate women must be residents of Karnataka
The hospital should have minimum 10 inpatient beds
Should have proper functional Operation Theater and Delivery room
24 hrs availability of gynecologists, anesthetists and pediatricians
Should have link with Blood banks
exclusions: Pregnant women not belonging to BPL Family are not allowed to apply to the scheme
content.application_process: Offline. The pregnant women have to register their names with the Junior Female Health Assistant of the area. The women will issue ANC card. The beneficiaries are identified through the ANC cards issued to them. Then candidates can avail benefits from nearer registered hospitals.
documents_required: ANC registration number along with noting whether it is first or second delivery

faqs.question: Who is the Thayi Bhagya Scheme for?
faqs.answer: Pregnant women belonging from BPL family.

faqs.question: Which type of help does the government provide in this Scheme?
faqs.answer: Benefits in the form of delivery services free of costs and others.

faqs.question: How many kids can a woman avail of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefit is limited to the first two deliveries.

faqs.question: Are there any other benefits than free delivery?
faqs.answer: Free checkups and medicines will be provided.

faqs.question: What facilities will be provided by the hospital?
faqs.answer: The registered hospital will have proper functional Operation Theater and Delivery room, 24 hrs availability of gynecologists, anesthetists and pediatricians.

faqs.question: Whom to approach for applying to this scheme?
faqs.answer: The pregnant women will have to register their names with the Junior Female Health Assistant of the area.
